company_context:
Acquirer: **AstraTech Solutions** – Global enterprise‑software & cloud services leader (SaaS, AI, data‑analytics) with $12B FY2025 revenue, 22,000 employees, HQ in Seattle, WA.
Target: **MedPulse Health** – Digital health platform providing integrated EHR, tele‑health, and patient‑engagement tools. 800 employees, $250M FY2025 revenue, headquartered in Boston, MA.
Legal close date: **31 Dec 2025**.
Integration kickoff: **10 Jan 2026** (Day 0).
Integration team (22 members) covering HR, IT, Finance, Product, Sales, Operations, Legal, Change Management and Communications.
Key workstreams: HR (talent retention, benefits harmonisation), IT (cloud migration, data‑security, HIPAA compliance), Finance (reporting, cost‑synergy tracking), Product (road‑map alignment, platform integration), Sales (account transition, cross‑sell enablement), Operations (process standardisation, supply‑chain).
Day‑1 priorities:
- Publish unified “Day‑1” communication from CEOs.
- Secure HIPAA‑compliant data‑center cut‑over (no downtime >5 min).
- Activate joint finance reporting system (SAP S/4HANA).
- Freeze hiring & compensation changes pending HR integration plan.
- Transfer top‑10 MedPulse accounts to AstraTech sales enablement tools.
- Deploy temporary “Integration Command Center”.
100‑day focus:
- Capture $45M cost synergies (head‑count rationalisation, cloud‑cost optimisation, procurement).
- Initiate $30M revenue synergies (cross‑sell of AstraTech AI analytics to MedPulse clients).
- Complete full product‑platform integration and launch joint roadmap.
- Achieve >95% employee retention and >90% customer NPS post‑integration.
Cultural considerations: AstraTech’s fast‑paced, data‑driven, “move‑fast” culture vs. MedPulse’s patient‑centric, highly regulated, consensus‑driven environment. Integration plan includes cultural‑alignment workshops, “Health‑Tech Innovation Labs”, and a joint “Values Charter”.
Synergy targets: $45M cumulative cost synergies by FY2027; $30M incremental revenue synergies by FY2028.
Communication strategy: CEO town‑hall (Day 0), weekly Integration Newsletter, dedicated intranet portal “AstraPulse Hub”, bi‑weekly stakeholder briefings, and a 24‑hour “Ask‑Me‑Anything” channel with integration leads.
meeting_event_details: Integration Kick‑off Steering Committee Meeting – **Date:** 10 Jan 2026, **Time:** 09:00‑12:00 EST, **Duration:** 3 hours, **Location:** AstraTech HQ, 5th‑Floor Executive Boardroom, Seattle, WA (virtual dial‑in for MedPulse execs).

stakeholders.responsibility: Represent target leadership, champion cultural alignment.

stakeholders.responsibility: MedPulse IT liaison, data migration validation.

stakeholders.responsibility: MedPulse sales integration, key account hand‑off.

deliverables: Integration Charter signed by both CEOs (by 15 Jan 2026).
Day‑1 Communication Pack (CEO letter, FAQ, org‑chart) ready for release (09:30 EST, 10 Jan).
30‑60‑90 Day Integration Roadmap (PowerPoint) approved by IMO (by 20 Jan).
Synergy Tracking Dashboard (Power BI) live with baseline data (by 31 Jan).
Combined Organizational Structure & Role‑Assignment Matrix (by 05 Feb).
IT Cloud Migration Plan with cut‑over schedule, rollback procedures, and HIPAA audit checklist (by 12 Feb).
Product Integration Blueprint – joint roadmap, feature de‑duplication, go‑to‑market plan (by 28 Feb).
Sales Account Transition Playbook – top‑20 accounts, cross‑sell scripts, CRM data migration (by 15 Mar).
HR Benefits Harmonisation Guide and Retention Bonus Program (by 22 Mar).
Risk Register & Mitigation Log (continuous, first version by 10 Jan).
Weekly Integration Status Report (distributed every Friday).
success_criteria: Complete all Day‑1 activities with <5 min system downtime and 100% critical‑process continuity.
Achieve ≥95% employee retention (baseline 800 MedPulse staff) through 6 months post‑close.
Capture at least $30M of the $45M cost‑synergy target by end of FY2027 (66%).
Launch joint product roadmap and release first integrated feature by 30 Jun 2026.
Cross‑sell revenue of $10M from AstraTech analytics to MedPulse client base by 31 Dec 2026.
Maintain HIPAA compliance audit score ≥ 95% after IT migration.
Customer Net Promoter Score (NPS) ≥ 90% for combined offering within 90 days of integration.
Integration budget not to exceed $12M (excluding transaction fees).
All key stakeholder briefings delivered on schedule (≥90% on‑time).
constraints: IT cloud migration must be completed within 45 days of kickoff to meet contractual SLA with third‑party provider.
Integration budget capped at $12M; any overruns require board approval.
MedPulse’s HIPAA‑covered data cannot be transferred to non‑certified environments; must use AstraTech’s FedRAMP‑authorized cloud region.
Key executives (CEO, CFO) unavailable 24‑28 Dec 2025 (holiday); all pre‑close approvals must be secured by 20 Dec.
Dependency on MedPulse’s legacy EHR vendor for data export windows (two 8‑hour windows in Jan).
Regulatory filing deadline – antitrust clearance must be obtained by 15 Nov 2025; any delay pushes legal close date.
Limited availability of MedPulse’s senior sales team (Q1 sales quota period).
workback_prompt: Create a detailed, day‑by‑day workback plan for the AstraTech Solutions – MedPulse Health integration described above. The plan should cover all key workstreams (HR, IT, Finance, Product, Sales, Operations), map each deliverable to a specific date, assign owners from the stakeholder list, identify dependencies, flag critical path items, and embed the Day‑1 and 100‑day priorities. Include risk mitigation actions, budget checkpoints, and communication milestones. Output the plan in a table format suitable for the Integration Management Office to track progress against the success criteria and constraints.

scenario_name: Apex BioPharma – NeuroGenix Therapeutics Integration (Extreme Complexity)
company_context: Acquiring Company: **Apex BioPharma Inc.**, a global, publicly‑traded (NASDAQ: APBX) biopharmaceutical leader focused on oncology and immunology with $12B FY2024 revenue and 18,000 employees worldwide. Target Company: **NeuroGenix Therapeutics Ltd.**, a privately‑held European biotech specializing in neuro‑degenerative disease pipelines, ~1,200 employees, $850M FY2024 revenue, headquartered in Basel, Switzerland. Legal Close Date: **2025‑12‑15**. Integration Kickoff Date (Day 0): **2025‑12‑20**. Integration Team (22 members) spans the following workstreams: HR, IT, Finance, Product Development, Sales & Marketing, Operations & Manufacturing, Regulatory Affairs, Legal & Compliance, Change Management, Integration PMO. Day‑1 Priorities: payroll & benefits go‑live, core ERP (SAP) data migration, unified finance reporting, immediate customer communication, critical IT security cut‑over, joint leadership town‑hall. 100‑Day Plan Focus: capture $120M cost synergies, launch combined pipeline review, align sales territories, harmonize manufacturing sites, embed cultural integration initiatives. Cultural Considerations: Apex operates a US‑centric, data‑driven, hierarchical model; NeuroGenix has a European, collaborative, research‑first culture with strong autonomy. Synergy Targets: $120M cumulative cost synergies by Year 2; $200M incremental revenue synergies by Year 3. Communication Strategy: CEO‑led global town‑hall (Day 1), weekly integration newsletters, dedicated intranet portal “OneApex”, quarterly external press releases, bilingual (English/German) updates for European staff.
meeting_event_details: Integration Kickoff Meeting – **2025‑12‑20**, 09:00‑12:00 EST (3 hours), Apex BioPharma Headquarters, New York City, 45th Floor – Conference Room “Skyline”. Virtual dial‑in via Teams for European participants. Agenda: integration charter review, workstream charters, Day‑1 readiness status, risk register, communication rollout, Q&A.
stakeholders: Dr. Maya Patel – Chief Executive Officer (Apex) – Overall integration sponsor
John Liu – Chief Financial Officer (Apex) – Finance & synergy tracking
Sofia Ramirez – Head of M&A (Apex) – Deal execution & governance
Michael O'Connor – Integration Lead (Apex) – PMO & overall schedule
Laura Chen – HR Lead (Apex) – Workforce alignment, retention, benefits
Raj Patel – IT Lead (Apex) – ERP migration, cybersecurity, infrastructure
Emily Grant – Finance Lead (Apex) – Consolidated reporting, accounting policies
Dr. Sven Keller – Product Development Lead (Apex) – Pipeline integration
Carlos Mendes – Sales & Marketing Lead (Apex) – Territory mapping, cross‑sell
Anita Singh – Operations & Manufacturing Lead (Apex) – Site rationalization
Dr. Ingrid Novak – Regulatory Affairs Lead (Apex) – FDA/EMA compliance
Thomas Greene – General Counsel (Apex) – Legal & compliance oversight
Rachel Adams – Change Management Lead (Apex) – Cultural integration, training
Diana Torres – Communications Lead (Apex) – Internal & external messaging
Victor Huang – PMO Lead (Apex) – Project controls, reporting
Dr. Markus Weber – CEO (NeuroGenix) – Target company sponsor
Claudia Müller – CFO (NeuroGenix) – Finance transition partner
Lars Berg – Head of R&D (NeuroGenix) – Pipeline stewardship
Sophie Dubois – HR Director (NeuroGenix) – Employee engagement
Johan Svensson – IT Director (NeuroGenix) – Legacy system hand‑over
deliverables: Integration Charter signed by both CEOs
Day‑1 Readiness Checklist (HR, IT, Finance, Legal) with sign‑off
30‑60‑90 Day Milestone Schedule per workstream
Synergy Tracking Model (cost & revenue) in PowerBI
Cultural Integration Playbook (workshops, onboarding, metrics)
Comprehensive Communication Plan (internal, external, bilingual)
IT Migration Plan (SAP S/4HANA cut‑over, data validation, security)
Finance Consolidation Blueprint (GAAP/IFRS alignment, reporting calendar)
Regulatory Transition Checklist (clinical trial continuity, filings)
Risk Register with mitigation actions and owners
success_criteria: All Day‑1 tasks completed within 48 hours of legal close with zero critical incidents
≥90 % employee retention in the first 30 days post‑close
$50 M of cost synergies realized by Day 100
Zero disruption to ongoing clinical trials and regulatory submissions
IT systems fully operational (SAP, CRM) with <2 % error rate in first month
Stakeholder satisfaction score ≥85 % in post‑kickoff survey
All external communications released on schedule with positive media sentiment
constraints: Legal close must occur by 2025‑12‑15; integration kickoff no later than 2025‑12‑20
Integration budget capped at $10 M (excluding transaction fees)
Both companies must maintain compliance with FDA, EMA, and GDPR throughout integration
Limited overlap of ERP systems – Apex SAP S/4HANA vs. NeuroGenix legacy Oracle; migration must be phased
Ongoing Phase III clinical trials cannot be paused; data integrity must be preserved
Key talent in NeuroGenix R&D identified as retention risk – must be addressed in Day‑1 plan
workback_prompt: Create a detailed workback plan for the Apex BioPharma – NeuroGenix Therapeutics integration scenario described above. The plan should cover all workstreams (HR, IT, Finance, Product Development, Sales & Marketing, Operations & Manufacturing, Regulatory Affairs, Legal & Compliance, Change Management, PMO), list day‑1 priorities, outline 30‑60‑90‑day milestones, allocate resources (15‑30 integration team members), identify risks and mitigation actions, define communication cadence (town‑halls, newsletters, intranet updates), and include metrics to track progress toward the $120M cost‑synergy and $200M revenue‑synergy targets.
